description: When squared gives number composed just of the digits 1, 2, 3, 4.
links: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10001
maple: filter:= t -> convert(convert(t^2,base,10),set) subset {1,2,3,4}:select(filter, [seq(seq(x, x=ceil(sqrt((10^i-1)/9)) .. floor(sqrt(4*(10^i-1)/9))),i=1..10)]); # _Robert Israel_, Mar 01 2016
mathematica: Do[ If[ Union[ Join[ {1, 2, 3, 4}, IntegerDigits[n^2] ] ] == {1, 2, 3, 4}, Print[n] ], {n, 0, 200000} ]
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = my(d = digits(n^2)); vecmin(d) && (vecmax(d) <= 4); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 29 2016
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 23 2001
